articles.name: Send Training Notifications Using SecurityCoach Delivery Methods
articles.title: Send Training Notifications Using SecurityCoach Delivery Methods
articles.body:
If you have access to SecurityCoach, you can send Training Notifications to your users via Slack, Microsoft Teams, or Google Chat. You can set up SecurityCoach integrations with Slack, Microsoft Teams, and Google Chat to be used as delivery methods for SecurityTips. Since SecurityCoach is a product within the KSAT console, you can use these same integrations to send your users notifications about their assigned training.

Important:You must first set up your delivery methods in SecurityCoach to send training notifications via Slack and Microsoft Teams. To learn how to set up these delivery methods see our Slack Integration Guide, Microsoft Teams Integration Guide, or Google Chat Integration Guide.

Once your SecurityCoach delivery methods have been set up, you can select the delivery method wherever you set up a training notification. You can set up training notifications when you create a new training campaign or edit an existing training campaign. You also have the option to send manual notifications from the campaign Overview or Users subtabs. The gif below shows the three areas of the console where you can set up training notifications.

To send a training notification using your SecurityCoach delivery method, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to one of the areas in the console where you can set up training notifications.
  2. Click on the applicable button to add new a training notification.
  3. From the top of the training notification section, select your preferred delivery method.
  4. We recommend selecting the Fallback to email delivery option. When this option is enabled, notifications will be used as a backup delivery method if your primary delivery method is unavailable.
  5. Select your notification type.
  6. Select the recipient types and specific notification templates.
    Important:Not all training notification templates are optimized for Slack and Microsoft Teams. We recommend setting up a training campaign assigned to select admins to test your selected notification templates before sending them out to your users.
  7. Click Save.

For more information about training notifications in general see our Training Campaign Notifications article.

articles.name: Customize and View Detection Rules Activity Reports
articles.title: Customize and View Detection Rules Activity Reports
articles.body:
The SecurityCoach > Reports subtab contains Detection Rules Activity Reports to monitor data related to your organization's detection rules. You can customize these reports to display specific data, such as activity for specific detection rule categories, vendors, or risk levels. Select Detection Rules Report > Source Data to access these reports.

You can export your Detection Rules Activity Reports as CSV files for future use, save them, send them, and schedule them to send. For more information, see our Save and Send Reports article.

Customizing Detection Rules Activity Reports

To view specific data, you can apply filters to a Detection Rules Activity Report. For example, you can use the Vendors and Date Range filters to select and show all CrowdStrike detections for the last 30 days.

To learn about the filters you can apply to your Detection Rules Activity Reports, see the subsections below.

Detection Rules Activity

The Detection Rules Activity report type displays detailed information for each rule detection. To learn more about applying filters to, exporting, and saving this report, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Report Type: Use this filter to choose your report type.
  2. Detection Rules: Use this filter to select the detection rules that you would like to display in this report.
  3. User: Use this search bar to select or enter the name of a user that you would like to display in this report.
  4. Date Range: Use this filter to select the date range that you would like to display in this report.
  5. Add Filter: Use this drop-down menu to add additional optional filters to your report.
  6. Detection Rule Categories: Use this filter to select the detection rule categories that you would like to display in this report.
  7. Vendors: Use this filter to select the vendors that you would like to display in this report.
  8. Risk Levels: Use this filter to select the risk levels that you would like to display in this report. You can select Medium, High, or Very High.
  9. Export as: Use this button to export the generated report as a CSV file. CSV files you generate will be available for download in the Download Center. For information, see our Download Center Overview.
  10. Save Report: Use this button to save the report to your Saved Reports subtab. For more information, see our Save and Send Reports article.

Detection Rules Activity Grouped by User

The Detection Rules Activity Grouped by User report type displays combined data for each user’s rule detections. To learn more about applying filters to, exporting, and saving this report, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Report Type: Use this filter to choose your report type.
  2. Detection Rules: Use this filter to select the detection rules that you would like to display in this report.
  3. Rule Detections: Use this filter to select the rule detections that you would like to display in this report.
  4. User: Use this search bar to select or enter the name of a user that you would like to display in this report.
  5. Date Range: Use this filter to select the date range that you would like to display in this report.
  6. Add Filter: Use this drop-down menu to add additional optional filters to your report.
  7. Detection Rule Categories: Use this filter to select the detection rule categories that you would like to display in this report.
  8. Vendors: Use this filter to select the vendors that you would like to display in this report.
  9. Export as: Use this button to export the generated report as a CSV file. CSV files you generate will be available for download in the Download Center. For information, see our Download Center Overview.
  10. Save Report: Use this button to save the report to your Saved Reports subtab. For more information, see our Save and Send Reports article.

Viewing Detection Rules Activity Reports

Once you apply your filters and the report has been generated, a table will display with information about your organization’s rule detections. You can customize this table by selecting which columns to display using the Manage Columns drop-down menu.

From the drop-down menu, select and deselect which column data should be displayed in the table.

articles.name: Webhooks in Your KnowBe4 Console
articles.title: Webhooks in Your KnowBe4 Console
articles.body:
In your KSAT console, you can create webhooks to send real-time phishing and training data to the other applications you use. Webhooks, limited to Platinum and Diamond customers, create a connection to send data from one application to another application through a payload. You can configure webhooks to perform specific actions when they receive data. For example, you could create a KSAT webhook to send your users’ phishing event data to a data analysis platform such as Splunk so you can monitor that data from Splunk.

Creating Webhooks in Your KSAT Console

To create a webhook, follow the steps below:

  1. From your KSAT admin account, click your email address at the top-right corner of the page and select Account Settings.
  2. Navigate to Account Integrations > Webhooks.
  3. Click the + Create button.
  4. Fill out the fields in the Create Webhook section. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:
    1. Name: Enter a name that describes the purpose of your webhook.
    2. URL: Enter the URL that you would like to send data to. For example, if you are creating a webhook for Slack, you could enter the URL for a specific Slack channel.
    3. Enable Webhook Failure Notifications: Select this check box to enable webhook failure notifications. Recipients will receive an email notification if the webhook receives 50 percent of the allowed failed responses in an hour. A second notification will be sent if the webhook exceeds the allowed number of failed responses and is deactivated. To learn more about how the allowed number of failed responses, see the Webhook Deactivation Policy section below.
    4. Authentication: If you would like to use authentication to authorize the webhook, select an authentication method. Once you select an authentication method, additional fields will display for you to enter information about it.
    5. Custom Data: To add custom data to your webhook’s payload, click the plus sign icon. Then, fill out the Key and Value fields. For example, if your application requires "{ "System" : "KnowBe4" }" in the payload to receive data, you could enter "System" and "KnowBe4".
    6. Custom Header: If you would like to add a custom header, click the plus sign icon. Then, fill out the Key and Value fields. For example, if your firewall requires the "{ "Header" : "KnowBe4" }” header to allow data to pass through, you could enter "Header" and "KnowBe4".
    7. Status: Select the status of your webhook. To use the webhook after it is created, select Active.
    8. Events: Select the events to send to your webhook. To select all Phishing Events, Training Events, or General Events, select the corresponding check boxes. To select specific events, click the drop-down arrow next to an option and then select the check boxes next to the events.

Webhook Retry Policy

If a webhook request fails, KSAT will retry the failed webhook up to three additional times. These retries will have a 15-minute delay between each request.

Webhook Deactivation Policy

If a webhook connection receives more than 1,000 failed responses in an hour, the webhook will be deactivated. We recommend verifying that the webhook is configured correctly and that the recipient server can receive webhook requests. You can then set the webhook’s status back to Active in your Account Settings.

articles.name: User Location Limitations
articles.title: User Location Limitations
articles.body:
KnowBe4 is committed to conducting business in accordance with applicable economic sanctions programs and export control requirements enforced by the United States and other jurisdictions where it operates. Such laws prohibit KnowBe4 from participating in certain transactions involving restricted countries or parties, be it directly or indirectly through third parties. KnowBe4 may additionally restrict access to certain high risk territories, in its discretion.

Currently, KnowBe4 does not sell or permit access to its products and services (including its free tools) in the following countries/territories for legal and business reasons:

  • Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhya (regions in Ukraine)
  • Iran
  • North Korea
  • Syria
  • Cuba
  • Russia
  • Belarus

For example, when selling to a customer with a global presence, we will not allow the customer to include its users that are located in the above countries/territories. Additionally, it is prohibited to allow users to access KnowBe4’s products and services (including KnowBe4’s free tools) while traveling to those locations.

In addition, KnowBe4 does not provide, sell or transfer any products, services, technology, software or technical data to, or otherwise engage in business with, any of the following:

  • Parties targeted for boycotts, embargoes, sanctions, or other similar measures by the United Nations Security Council;
  • Parties appearing on the European Union’s Consolidated Sanctions List; the United Kingdom’s List of Consolidated Financial Sanctions Targets;
  • Parties appearing on the Denied Persons List, Entity List, and Unverified List administered by the U.S. Commerce Department;
  • Parties appearing on the sanctions lists administered by the U.S. Treasury Department’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (“OFAC”) and the U.S. State Department;
  • Countries or regions subject to U.S. embargoes or sanctions; or
  • Parties that are at least 50% owned or controlled by parties subject to sanctions programs administered by OFAC, whether individually or in the aggregate.

KnowBe4 may take certain precautions to prohibit access to its products and services, such as implementing GeoIP and domain blocks to restrict access as it deems appropriate.

If local laws prohibit the storing or processing of certain data outside of the country or territory in which a data subject is located, you are prohibited from adding users to an instance that would be unlawful. KnowBe4 currently has data centers in:

  • Canada
  • United States
  • European Union
  • United Kingdom

articles.name: Smart Groups Training Automation Guide
articles.title: Smart Groups Training Automation Guide
articles.body:
In this article, you’ll learn how to automate remedial training, periodic training, and a variety of other training processes with Smart Groups. Remedial training automatically assigns training content to users who fail a Phishing Security Test (PST). Periodic training allows you to assign sets of training content at specific times or in a specific order. The additional training processes in this article can help you train specific groups of users, such as new hires, based on your organization’s needs.

Tip: We offer an editable worksheet to help you plan your training campaign settings. To download this worksheet, see our Phishing and Training Campaign Planning Resources article.

For general information about using Smart Groups, see our Smart Groups Quickstart Guide.

Automated Remedial Training

We recommend automating remedial training enrollments for users who fail a Phishing Security Test (PST). When a user fails a PST, they will be automatically added to a Smart Group and assigned remedial training content of your choice. If they complete the training and fail another PST, they will receive a second round of remedial training content. This process encourages your phish-prone users to develop strong security habits.

Step One: Choose Your Remedial Training Content

Before you build your automated training process, plan how many rounds of remedial training you would like to create. The number of PSTs a user fails will determine how many rounds of training they’re assigned. For example, a user who fails two PSTs will be enrolled in two rounds of training. A standard remedial training plan includes three rounds of training, with one training campaign per round.

Tip: If you want to download a planning worksheet for your training campaigns, see our Phishing and Training Campaign Planning Resources.

Once you’ve finished your planning, browse the ModStore to choose the training content you want to assign in each round of remedial training. We recommend selecting training content about common phishing threats and social engineering red flags. If you need help choosing training content, the Phish-Prone Recommendations section of the ModStore has training options for phish-prone users. Also, be sure to choose content that you haven’t assigned to any other training campaign. Adding unique content ensures that your remedial training Smart Groups will work properly.

Once you’ve selected your training content, you can begin creating your Smart Groups.

Step Two: Create a Smart Group for Each Round of Remedial Training

Next, create a Smart Group to correspond with each round of remedial training. Select the tabs below to see the recommended settings for each Smart Group:

This Smart Group will include users who have failed one PST in the last month.

Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “Remedial Training Round 1”. From the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select Phish Event. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Phish Event: Select Failed Phishing Test.
  3. Comparison: Select Equal.
  4. Count: Select 1.
  5. Time Frame: Select Range. For the first date selection, select the earliest date you want to see for your users’ phishing failures. Clear the value in the second date selection, as KSAT will accept all phishing failures that happened after the date you just selected.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, from the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select Training. Add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the assignments you want to assign to users in the first round of remedial training.
  5. Time Frame: Select Range. For the first date selection, select the earliest date you want to see for your users’ phishing failures. Clear the value in the second date selection, as KSAT will accept all phishing failures that happened after the date you just selected.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Phish Event User must have failed a phishing test once on or after [selected date].
Training User must not have completed [selected assignment].

These users will be automatically enrolled in your Remedial Training Round 1 training campaign.

Important: If you’ve recently set up your KSAT account, you may have sent a baseline phishing test to your users. Because your users will receive this baseline test before completing any security training, failures on this test will skew your Round 1 Smart Group results. We recommend adjusting the Time Frame on both criteria to exclude your baseline phishing test.

This Smart Group will include users who have failed more than one PST in a short period of time. These users will have already been enrolled in the training assignments from Round 1.

Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “Remedial Training Round 2”. Navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Phish Event. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Phish Event: Select Failed Phishing Test.
  3. Comparison: Select Equal.
  4. Count: Select 2.
  5. Time Frame: Select Range. For the first date selection, select the earliest date you want to see for your users’ phishing failures. Clear the value in the second date selection, as KSAT will accept all phishing failures that happened after the date you just selected.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you’ve added your phish event criteria, add your training criteria. For this Smart Group, you will need to add two training criteria.

To add your first training criteria, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the training assignments that you want to use in the second round of remedial training.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you’ve added your first training criteria, add your second training criteria.
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the training assignments that you want to use in the second round of remedial training.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Phish Event User must have failed a phishing test exactly two times on or after [selected date].
Training User must not have completed [second round assignment].
Training User must have completed [first round assignment]

This criteria includes users who have failed phishing tests two times in the last four weeks, have completed the Round 1 remedial training, and have not completed the Round 2 remedial training.

This Smart Group will include users who have failed three or more PSTs in a short period of time. These users will have already been enrolled in the training assignments from Round 1 and Round 2. Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “Remedial Training Round 3”. Navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Phish Event. Then, add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Phish Event: Select Failed Phishing Test.
  3. Comparison: Select Greater Than.
  4. Count: Select 2.
  5. Time Frame: Select Range. For the first date selection, select the earliest date you want to see for your users’ phishing failures. Clear the value in the second date selection, as KSAT will accept all phishing failures that happened after the date you just selected.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the content you want to use for your third round of remedial training.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the content you used for the second round of remedial training.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Phish Event User must have failed a phishing test more than two times on or after [selected date].
Training User must not have completed [third round assignment].
Training User must have completed [second round assignment]

If you would like to add additional rounds of remedial training, create more Smart Groups using the Round 3 criteria. Make sure to adjust the content in your training criteria so they apply to the correct training rounds.

Step Three: Create Supporting Smart Groups

We recommend making two Smart Groups to support your remedial training process: a successful users Smart Group and an auditing Smart Group. Select the tabs below to view the recommended settings for each Smart Group:

The Successful Users Smart Group will include users who have not failed a PST since they finished remedial training. You can use this group to measure the success of your remedial training.

Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “Remedial Training Successful Users”. Navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select After Training. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Phish Event: Select Failed Phishing Test.
  3. Training Event: Select Completed.
  4. Assignments: Select your content from the first round of remedial training.
  5. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

After Training User must not have failed a phishing test after completing [first round assignment].

Remember that users in this group must have completed all of the content selected in your criterion. For example, if you select content from Rounds 1, 2, and 3 of remedial training, your Smart Group will only include users who have completed all three rounds.

Important: Your users might not fail enough PSTs to be enrolled in all three rounds of training. For this reason, we recommend only selecting your Round 1 training content for this Smart Group. Then, you can make another Smart Group for each round of training, if you would like.

The auditing Smart Group will include users who have failed PSTs but who did not get enrolled in remedial training. You can use this Smart Group to verify that your remedial training process is working properly.

Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “Remedial Training Audit Group”. Navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Phish Event. Then, add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Phish Event: Select Failed Phishing Test.
  3. Comparison: Select Greater Than.
  4. Count: Select 2.
  5. Time Frame: Select Duration. Then, select In the last, 12, and Months.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Enrolled.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the courses from every round of remedial training.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Phish Event User must have failed a phishing test more than two times after completing [first round assignment].
Training User must not have been enrolled in [selected assignments].

Step Four: Create a Training Campaign for Each Round

Now that you’ve created your Smart Groups, you can create your corresponding training campaigns.

Select the tabs below to see the recommended settings for each campaign.

For your Round 1 remedial training campaign, we recommend that you use the settings listed below:
  1. Campaign Name: Enter an identifiable name for the campaign, such as “Remedial Training Round 1”.
  2. End Date: Set a Relative Duration of 4 Weeks. This duration will give each user the same amount of time to complete the training once enrolled.
  3. Allow assignments to be completed after due date: Select this check box.
  4. Content: Select the content you selected for Round 1.
  5. Enable Content Survey: Select this check box. This setting allows users to rate each piece of content after completing it.
  6. Track Scores: Select this check box. This setting records your users’ results on any knowledge checks included in the content.
  7. Enroll Users: Select Specific Users, then select your Remedial Training Round 1 Smart Group.
  8. Enable automatic enrollment for new users: Select this check box.
    • If you want your users to take the same rounds of training multiple times if they fail, you can select the Enable progress reset for remedial training check box.
  9. Notifications: We recommend setting up the following notifications:
    • Welcome: Set up this notification for the user.
    • Remind Before Due Date: Set up this notification for the user and the user’s manager.
    • Campaign Completion: Set up this notification for the user.
    • Past Due: Set up this notification for the user’s manager. We recommend sending the first notification three days after the campaign’s due date. Then, send another Past Due notification every seven days after the due date.

For your Round 2 remedial training campaign, we recommend that you use the settings listed below:
  1. Campaign Name: Enter an identifiable name for the campaign, such as “Remedial Training Round 2”.
  2. End Date: Set a Relative Duration of 4 Weeks. This duration will give each user the same amount of time to complete the training once enrolled.
  3. Allow assignments to be completed after due date: Select this check box.
  4. Content: Select the content you selected for Round 2.
  5. Enable Content Survey: Select this check box. This setting allows users to rate each piece of content after completing it.
  6. Track Scores: Select this check box. This setting records your users’ results on any knowledge checks included in the content.
  7. Enroll Users: Select Specific Users, then select your Remedial Training Round 2 Smart Group.
  8. Enable automatic enrollment for new users: Select this check box.
    • If you want your users to take the same rounds of training multiple times if they fail, you can select the Enable progress reset for remedial training check box.
  9. Notifications: We recommend setting up the following notifications:
    • Welcome: Set up this notification for the user.
    • Remind Before Due Date: Set up this notification for the user and the user’s manager.
    • Campaign Completion: Set up this notification for the user.
    • Past Due: Set up this notification for the user’s manager. We recommend sending the first notification three days after the campaign’s due date. Then, send another Past Due notification every seven days after the due date.

For your Round 3 remedial training campaign, we recommend that you use the settings listed below:
  1. Campaign Name: Enter an identifiable name for the campaign, such as “Remedial Training Round 3”.
  2. End Date: Set a Relative Duration of 4 Weeks. This duration will give each user the same amount of time to complete the training once enrolled.
  3. Allow assignments to be completed after due date: Select this check box.
  4. Content: Select the content you selected for Round 3.
  5. Enable Content Survey: Select this check box. This setting allows users to rate each piece of content after completing it.
  6. Track Scores: Select this check box. This setting records your users’ results on any knowledge checks included in the content.
  7. Enroll Users: Select Specific Users, then select your Remedial Training Round 3 Smart Group.
  8. Enable automatic enrollment for new users: Select this check box.
    • If you want your users to take the same rounds of training multiple times if they fail, you can select the Enable progress reset for remedial training check box.
  9. Notifications: We recommend setting up the following notifications:
    • Welcome: Set up this notification for the user.
    • Remind Before Due Date: Set up this notification for the user and the user’s manager.
    • Campaign Completion: Set up this notification for the user.
    • Past Due: Set up this notification for the user’s manager. We recommend sending the first notification three days after the campaign’s due date. Then, send another Past Due notification every seven days after the due date.

If you planned more than three rounds of remedial training, repeat the steps above to make a campaign for each additional round.

Automated Periodic Training

Automated periodic training allows you to set up phases of training that will be periodically assigned to your users. This process works best if you want to assign training modules in a specific order or at specific times, rather than assigning all of the modules to your users at once.

Step One: Plan Your Periodic Training Timeline

We recommend planning your full periodic training timeline before you create any Smart Groups or training campaigns. This timeline should include the training modules you want to assign to your users in each phase of your periodic training process.

Follow the steps below to plan your periodic training timeline:

  1. Decide how many phases of periodic training you would like to set up. The number of phases you create will depend on your organization’s goals and how much training content you want your users to complete.
  2. Browse the ModStore to choose the training content you want to assign to each phase. Make sure you add the content to your Library subtab so you can use it in your training campaigns.
  3. Determine the order in which your users should receive the training content.
  4. Decide when each phase of training should begin. For example, you could assign one phase of training per month.
Tip: To download a planning worksheet for your training campaigns, see our Phishing and Training Campaign Planning Resources.

Step Two: Create a Smart Group for Each Phase of Your Process

Next, create a Smart Group for each phase of your training plan. For this example, we have outlined criteria for two phases of periodic training. Select the tabs below to view the recommended settings for each Smart Group:

This Smart Group will include all users in your organization except your new hires. It is the starting point for your training plan.

Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “Periodic Training Phase 1”. From the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select User Date. Then, add the following criteria to the Smart Group:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Date Type: Select Created.
  3. Time Frame: Select Duration. Then, select Prior to the last, 1, and Months.
  4. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select Any Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select your Phase 1 training modules.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

User Date User must have been created prior to the last month.
Training User must not have completed [selected assignment].

This Smart Group will include users who have completed the content from Phase 1 of your training plan, but have not completed any Phase 2 content yet.

Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “Periodic Training Phase 2”. Navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select Any Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select your Phase 1 training modules.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select Any Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select your Phase 2 training modules.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Training User must have completed [phase 1 assignments].
Training User must not have completed [phase 2 assignments].

To create additional training phase Smart Groups, repeat the format of your Phase 2 group. Make sure to adjust the content in your criteria so that they apply to the correct training phases.

Step Three: Create Your Training Campaigns

Lastly, create a training campaign for each phase of your process. To complete this process, you will assign your Smart Groups to these campaigns.

Select the tabs below to see the recommended settings for each campaign. You can configure any additional settings to match your preferences.

For your Phase 1 periodic training campaign, we recommend that you use the settings listed below:
  1. Campaign Name: Enter an identifiable name for the campaign, such as “Periodic Training Phase 1”.
  2. End Date: Set a Relative Duration of 1 for Months. This duration will give each user the same amount of time to complete the training once enrolled.
  3. Content: Select the content you selected for Phase 1 of your training plan.
  4. Enroll Users: Select Specific Users, then select your Periodic Training Phase 1 Smart Group.
  5. Enable automatic enrollment for new users: Select this check box.
  6. Notifications: We recommend setting up the following notifications:
    • Welcome: Set up this notification for the User.
    • Remind Before Due Date: Set up this notification for the user and the user’s manager.
    • Campaign Completion: Set up this notification for the user.
    • Past Due: Set up this notification for the user’s Manager. We recommend sending the first notification three days after the campaign’s due date. Then, send another Past Due notification every seven days after the due date.

For your Phase 2 periodic training campaign, we recommend cloning the Phase 1 training campaign and editing that campaign. Follow the settings and steps below to create your Phase 2 campaign:
  1. In your KSAT console, navigate to Training > Campaigns.
  2. Select the Actions drop-down menu on the right side of your Round 1 campaign.
  3. From the Actions drop-down menu that displays, select Clone.
  4. Open the cloned campaign and edit the following settings:
    1. Campaign Name: Enter an identifiable name, such as “Periodic Training Phase 2”.
    2. Content: Select the content you chose for Phase 2 of your training plan.
    3. Enroll Users: Select Specific Users, then select your Periodic Training Phase 2 Smart Group.

The remaining settings should be the same as the Phase 1 training campaign.

Repeat the steps listed in the Phase 2 tab for any additional phases of training you would like to create. Make sure that you have a matching training campaign for every Smart Group you created for periodic training.

Additional Automated Training Processes

In addition to remedial training and periodic training, you can use Smart Groups to automate a variety of training processes. The sections below outline some common examples of automated training processes. You can customize all of these processes to meet your organization’s needs.

Read the articles below for tips on how to automate training processes based on the following factors:

  • New Hire Training
  • Annual Training
  • Specific User Training Needs
Tip: If you want to create a training process that isn’t covered in this article, we recommend downloading our Smart Groups Planning Worksheet. This worksheet helps you plan your own automated process with Smart Groups. You can also reference our Smart Groups Glossary of Criteria Types for more information on the types of Smart Groups you can create.

New Hire Training

We recommend using Smart Groups to automatically enroll new hires in security training as you add them to your KSAT console.

Before you begin, browse the ModStore to choose the training content you want to assign to your new hires. Remember to add your selected training content to your Library subtab so you can assign it to a campaign.

This Smart Group will include all of your new hires. Create a Smart Group and name it something identifiable, such as “New Hires”. From the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select User Date. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Date Type: Select Created.
  3. Time Frame: Select Duration. Then, select your desired timeframe.
  4. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Now, select your training criteria. From the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select Training.

Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select your desired new hire training content.
  5. Time Frame: Select Any.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

User Date User must have been created in the last [timeframe].
Training User must not have completed [new hire assignment].

User date criteria will work whether you use Active Directory Integration or import your users manually.

Once you’ve created your Smart Group, create your new hire training campaign and assign it to the Smart Group. When you create this training campaign, make sure you select the same content that you selected for your training criterion.

Annual Training

We recommend using Smart Groups to automate annual training assignments for your users. You can customize this process to target specific characteristics, such as users who have already completed new hire training or users who are overdue for annual training.

Annual Refresher Training

This Smart Group will include users who have not completed annual security training in the last 11 months.

Important: The process below explains how to build an annual training process. If you want to train users on a different schedule, such as quarterly training, adjust the Time Frame of the criteria.

Before you begin, browse the ModStore to choose training content for your refresher training campaign. Remember to add your selected training content to your Library subtab so you can assign it to a campaign.

To create this Smart Group, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select Any Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the desired annual training assignments.
  5. Time Frame: Select Duration, In the last, 11, and Months.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, click Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criterion will state:

Training User must not have completed [annual training assignment] in the last 11 months.

Then, create an annual training campaign and assign it to this Smart Group. When you create your campaign, make sure you select the same content that you selected in your Smart Group.

Annual Training After New Hire Training

This Smart Group helps you automatically assign annual refresher training to your users.

Important: Users will only be included in this group after they’ve completed their new hire training.

To create this Smart Group, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Training Event: Select Enrolled.
  3. Scope: Select Any Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the desired new hire training assignments.
  5. Time Frame: Adjust the Time Frame to the Duration of your new hire training campaign.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, from the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select Training. Add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select All Selected.
  4. Assignments: Select the desired annual training assignments.
  5. Time Frame: Select Duration, In the last, 12, and Months.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, click Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Training User must have been enrolled in [selected assignment] in the last [new hire campaign duration].
Training User must not have completed [annual training assignment] in the last 12 months.

Then, create an annual training campaign and assign it to this Smart Group. When you create your campaign, make sure you select the same content that you selected for your Smart Group.

Users Not Trained in the Past Year

This Smart Group will include users who haven’t been assigned training in the past year. We recommend using this group to find users who are overdue for annual refresher training.

To create this Smart Group, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Enrolled.
  3. Scope: Select Any Available.
  4. Time Frame: Select Duration, In the last, 12, and Months.
  5. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criterion will state:

Training User must not have been enrolled in any available courses in the last 12 months.

Specific User Training Needs

You can create various Smart Groups based on specific user information. For example, you can group inactive users to exclude them from your training campaigns. You can also use Smart Groups to identify users with overdue training assignments and send reminders to those users.

Users with Overdue Training

This Smart Group will include users who have overdue training assignments in any current training campaign.

To create this Smart Group, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select Any Available.
  4. Time Frame: Select Any.
  5. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, from the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select Training. Add the following criterion:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Training Event: Select Enrolled.
  3. Scope: Select Any Available.
  4. Time Frame: Select Any.
  5. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Training User must not have completed any available courses.
Training User must have been enrolled in any available courses.

Exclude Specific Users from Campaigns that are Assigned to All Users

This Smart Group allows you to exclude certain users from campaigns that are assigned to all of your users. We recommend creating this Smart Group if you have unmonitored admin accounts or any other inactive accounts in your KSAT console. Including inactive users in your campaigns may skew your Phish-prone Percentage and campaign results.

First, create a static user group for your inactive accounts. Name it something identifiable, such as “Inactive Users”.

After you make your static group, create a Smart Group to filter out your inactive users. Name this Smart Group something identifiable, such as “Phishable and Trainable Users”.

To create this Smart Group, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select User Field. Then, add the following criterion:
  1. User Field: Select Group Name.
  2. Condition: Select Must Not.
  3. Comparison: Select Equal.
  4. Values: Select the inactive user group.
  5. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, select Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criterion will state:

Training The group name must not be equal to [inactive user group name].

Untrained Users With At Least X PST Failures

This Smart Group will include users who have recently failed multiple PSTs and have not completed security training. We recommend using this Smart Group to track phish-prone users who could benefit from completing training.

To create this Smart Group, navigate to the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu and select Training. Then, add the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must Not.
  2. Training Event: Select Completed.
  3. Scope: Select Any Available.
  4. Time Frame: Select your desired timeframe.
  5. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

Then, from the Smart Group Criteria drop-down menu, select Phish Event. Enter the following criteria:
  1. Condition: Select Must.
  2. Phish Event: Select Failed Phishing Test.
  3. Comparison: Select Greater Than.
  4. Count: Select your desired amount.
  5. Time Frame: Select your desired timeframe.
  6. Save: After you’ve filled out the fields above, select Save.

After you've filled out the criteria listed above, click Save under the Smart Group Criteria section. Your finished criteria will state:

Training User must not have completed any available courses in the last [timeframe].
Phish Event User must have failed a phishing test more than 2 times in the last [timeframe].

articles.name: Learner Support: KnowBe4 Learner App
articles.title: Learner Support: KnowBe4 Learner App
articles.body:
The KnowBe4 Learner App allows you to access your training anytime and anywhere. On the app, you can complete training assignments, read messages, view badges, and more.

Important: You can enable notifications for the KnowBe4 Learner app. When you first open the app, you will receive a prompt to turn on notifications. If you choose to do so later, you can easily enable notifications at any time through your device's settings.

If your organization has the app enabled, you’ll see the KnowBe4 Learner App tab in your Learner Experience (LX). If you’re an admin who would like to enable the mobile app for your users, see our KnowBe4 Learner App Admin FAQ article.

To learn more about the KnowBe4 Learner App, read the sections below. If you prefer video tutorials, see our KnowBe4 Learner App Overview video.

To download the app, open your mobile device's app store. Then, search for the “KnowBe4 Learner App” and download the app. The app is compatible with Android version 8 and later and iOS version 11 and later.

App Store (Apple Devices) Google Play (Android Devices)

Once the app is downloaded, you can log in using one of the methods listed below.

Method 1: Scan Your QR Code

You can log in to the Knowbe4 Learner App by scanning your specific QR code. If you received an email with the subject line “KnowBe4 Learner App Now Available”, your QR code will be at the bottom of that email.

If you did not receive an email, or the QR code has expired, you can log in to your KnowBe4 training account. Then, click the KnowBe4 Learner App tab.

Important: You can link the KnowBe4 Learner App to a maximum of five devices simultaneously. To add a new device, you must first remove one of the currently linked devices from your account.

To scan your QR code, follow the steps below.

  1. Open the KnowBe4 Learner App on your mobile device.
  2. Tap Log In with QR Code.
  3. When the app displays a camera view, hover your device over the QR code to scan it. You will automatically be logged in.

Once you have logged in, you can use the KnowBe4 Learner App to download and complete training, read messages, view leaderboards, and more.

Method 2: Tap Your Login Link

You can log in to the Knowbe4 Learner App by clicking on your specific login link. If you received an email with the subject line “KnowBe4 Learner App Now Available”, your link will be in that email. Using your mobile device, you can open the email and tap Click to Log In to log in to the app automatically.

If you did not receive an email, or the link has expired, you can request a link by following the steps below.

  1. Open the KnowBe4 Learner App on your mobile device.
  2. Tap Log In with Link.
  3. Enter the email address you use for work. An email containing a login link will be sent to this address.
  4. Using your mobile device, open the email and tap Click to Log In to log in to the app automatically.

Once you have logged in, you can use the KnowBe4 Learner App to download and complete training, read messages, view leaderboards, and more.

Just like your KnowBe4 Learner Experience (LX), the KnowBe4 Learner App can be used to complete assigned training, review past training, acknowledge policies, and view completion certificates. You can also find optional learning content, read your messages, and view your badges and leaderboard.

Important: If you do not have an internet connection, you can still access the app. However, the app will have limited functionality and display an Offline Mode banner. To access all app features, you will need to reconnect to the internet.

The app is divided into four sections. For more information, click the tabs below:

The Training section of the KnowBe4 Learner App lists all of your training. A banner at the top of the page will display your training completion percentage. 

You can tap on a card to view more information about the training assignment. If you would like to start this training, tap Play on the page that opens.

You can also tap Download to make the training available offline. If an assignment isn’t available to download, the card will display Not Downloadable.

To view your completed assignments, scroll down to the bottom of the Training page.

You can tap on a card to view more information about that completed training assignment.

On the page that opens, you tap View Certificate to view and download your completion certificate. You can review the content by tapping Play or download the content by tapping Download.

The Library section of the KnowBe4 Learner App lists all of the optional learning content available to you. For information about the types of available content, see our Learner Support: Navigating the Learner Experience guide.

You can tap on a card to learn more about that content. If you would like to enroll in the content, tap the play icon on the page that opens. You can also tap Download to make the content available offline. If an assignment isn’t available to download, the card will display Not Downloadable.

The Messages section of the KnowBe4 Learner App lists messages sent to you from your organization. If you would like to read a message, you can tap on the name of that message. 

If you have unread messages, you will see a number next to the Messages icon at the bottom of the app.

In the Profile section of the KnowBe4 Learner App, you can view your achievements, access your app settings, change your app language, and manage your downloaded content.

Under Achievements, you can tap on the Badges card to view the badges you've earned and see which badges are still available.
Also under Achievements, you can tap on the Leaderboard card to view your organization’s leaderboard. 

To view your app settings, tap the gear icon in the top-right corner of the Profile page.

For more information about the available settings, see the list below:

  • Language: To change the language that your app is displayed in, tap the Language drop-down menu and select your preferred language.
  • Downloads Manager: Tap Downloads Manager to view a list of your downloaded content. You can pause downloads and delete downloads that you no longer need.
  • Need Help?: Tap Need Help? to learn more about the app. You can also report any issues or request help from our support team.
  • App Information: Tap App Information to view the app version number and other details.
  • Logout: Tap Logout to log out of the app. To log in to the app again later, follow the steps in the Setting Up the KnowBe4 Learner App section of this article.

You can link up to five devices to your KnowBe4 account. If you have reached five devices, but need to link a new device, you must unlink one of those devices.

To unlink a device, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KnowBe4 training account.
  2. Click the KnowBe4 Learner App tab.
  3. The Linked Devices section lists all of your linked devices.
  4. Find the device that you want to unlink and click Unlink Device.

Once you have unlinked a device, follow the steps in the Setting Up the KnowBe4 Learner App section above to link a new device.

articles.name: Carbon Black Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
articles.title: Carbon Black Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
articles.body:
In this article, you will learn how to integrate Carbon Black with SecurityCoach. Once the integration is complete, data provided by Carbon Black will be available for use under the SecurityCoach tab of your KSAT console. This data can be viewed in SecurityCoach reports and used to create detection rules for real-time coaching campaigns. For general information about SecurityCoach, see our SecurityCoach Product Manual.

Create a Custom Access Level

Before you can set up this integration in your KSAT console, you will need to create a custom access level and an API key.To create a custom access level, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your Carbon Black Cloud console and navigate to Settings > API Access > Access Levels.
  2. Click Add Access Level.
  3. In the Access Level section, enter a unique name and a description for the level.
    Important:You will need a level with a unique name in order to create an API Key.
  4. Locate the API Service Category in the permissions table and select the following Access Level:
    • For the category Alerts > General Information > org.alerts, select the READ check box.
    • For the category Alerts > Notes > org.alerts.notes, select the READ check box.

After you've selected the correct permissions for your access level, you can create your API key by following the steps in the Create an API Key section below.

Create an API Key

After you’ve created your custom access level, you can create a Carbon Black API key. You will need this key when you set up the integration in your KSAT console.

To create an API key, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your Carbon Black Cloud console and navigate to Settings > API Access > API Keys.
  2. Click Add API Key.
  3. In the Name field, enter a unique name for the API Key.
  4. From the Access Level Type drop-down menu, select Custom.
  5. From the Custom access level access drop-down menu, select the access level you created in the Create a Custom Access Level section above.
    Note:Choose a name that clearly distinguishes the API key from your organization’s other API keys.
  6. Click Save. After you click Save, your API Key Credentials, including your API Key and API ID, will display.
  7. Copy and save the API Key and API ID somewhere that you can easily access. You will need these credentials to complete the integration setup in the Set Up the Integration in Your KSAT Console section below.

Set Up the Integration in Your KSAT Console

To register Carbon Black with SecurityCoach in your KSAT console, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console and navigate to SecurityCoach > Setup > Security Vendor Integrations.
  2. Locate Carbon Black and click Configure.
  3. Enter the API ID and API Key that was created in the Create an API Key section above.
  4. Enter the API Domain, which is displayed in the URL of your Carbon Black Cloud console. For example, if your console URL is “https://dashboard.confer.net/”, your API domain would be “dashboard.confer.net”.
  5. Enter the Org Key, which is displayed in the API Access window of your Carbon Black Cloud console.
  6. Click Authorize.

Map Your Users

After you’ve finished integrating Carbon Black, you can map your users either through mapping rules (recommended) or through a CSV file upload. For more information about user mapping, see our Mapping Users in SecurityCoach article.

Once you’ve successfully authorized this integration, you can manage detection rules for Carbon Black on the Detection Rules subtab of SecurityCoach. For a full list of available system detection rules for this vendor, see our Which Detection Rules Can I Use with My Vendors? article.

articles.name: Training Information Placeholders Guide
articles.title: Training Information Placeholders Guide
articles.body:
You can use training information placeholders to populate specific information in your training campaign notifications. For general information about placeholders, see our How to Use Placeholders article.

Important:You can only use training information placeholders in the body of an email template. You are unable to use these placeholders in other areas of an email template, such as the subject line.

See the sections below to learn about the training information placeholders that you can use for each type of training notification.

Training Information Placeholders

You can use training information placeholders in user, admin, or manager training notifications, depending on the type of information that the placeholder displays.

Some placeholders can be used in any type of training notification. For information about each of these placeholders, see the table below:

Placeholder Name Placeholder Drop-Down Menu Option Information Populated
[[training_campaign]] Training Campaign This placeholder populates the name of the training campaign.
[[training_campaign_start_at]] Training Campaign Start At This placeholder populates the date that the training campaign started.

All other training information placeholders should either be used in user training notifications or be used in admin and manager training notifications. For more information, see the subsections below.

Placeholders for User Notifications

Some training information placeholders should only be used in user training notifications.

For information about each of these placeholders, see the table below:

Placeholder Name Placeholder Drop-Down Menu Option Information Populated
[[training_campaign_end_at]] Due Date

This placeholder populates the date that all the training content in the training campaign needs to be completed by.

If the training campaign does not have a due date or end date for the training content, the placeholder will be displayed as "(No End Date)".
[[training_campaign_days_remaining]] Number of days remaining in training campaign.

This placeholder populates the number of days remaining before the user's training is due. This placeholder will apply to the associated training campaign.

If the training campaign does not have a due date or end date, the placeholder will be displayed as "(Unlimited)".
[[days_overdue]] Number of days training is overdue.

This placeholder populates the number of days that have passed since the user's training assignments were due. This placeholder will apply to the associated training campaign.

Important:You should only use this placeholder in past due notifications.
[[login_link]] Login Link

This placeholder populates the link that your user will need to log in to take their training. This placeholder does not use HTML.

[[assignment_list]]

 Assignments List

This placeholder populates a list of assignments assigned to the user in the associated training campaign. These assignments will display as links and be listed on individual lines.

By default, users are taken to the specified training assignment in the Learner Experience (LX) when they click an assignment link.

You can disable the direct links and display the assignment list in plain text instead. To do this, deselect the Enable Direct Links in Training Notifications check box in your account settings. For more information, see our KSAT Account Settings: Training article.

The previous version of this placeholder, [[course_list]], is still supported.

[[incomplete_assignment_list]]

 Incomplete Assignments List

This placeholder populates a list of the user's incomplete assignments for the associated training campaign. These assignments will display as links and be listed on individual lines.

By default, users are taken to the specified training assignment in the Learner Experience (LX) when they click an assignment link.

You can disable the direct links and display the incomplete due assignment list in plain text instead. To do this, deselect the Enable Direct Links in Training Notifications check box in your account settings. For more information, see our KSAT Account Settings: Training article.

The previous version of this placeholder, [[incomplete_course_list]], is still supported.

[[assignment_list_count]]

 Assignments List Count

This placeholder populates the number of assignments in the campaign, displayed as "X Assignments."

The previous version of this placeholder, [[course_list_count]], is still supported.

[[incomplete_assignment_list_count]]

 Incomplete Assignments Count

This placeholder populates the number of incomplete assignments associated with the campaign, displayed as "X Assignments."

The previous version of this placeholder, [[incomplete_course_list_count]], is still supported.

[[pastdue_assignment_list]]

 Past Due Assignments

This placeholder populates a list of the user's past due assignments for the associated training campaign. These assignments will display as links and be listed on individual lines.

Note: You should only use this placeholder in past due notifications.

By default, users are taken to the specified training assignment in the Learner Experience (LX) when they click an assignment link.

You can disable the direct links and display the past due assignment list in plain text instead. To do this, deselect the Enable Direct Links in Training Notifications check box in your account settings. For more information, see our KSAT Account Settings: Training article.

[[pastdue_assignment_list_count]]

 Past Due Assignments Count

This placeholder populates the number of assignments that the user did not complete before the due date, displayed as "X Assignments." This placeholder applies to the associated training campaign.

For more information about past due training assignments, see our How to Modify Training Deadlines article.

Important:You should only use this placeholder in past due notifications.

[[extended_due_date]]

 Extended Due Date

This placeholder populates the new due date for the user’s training.

For more information about extended due dates, see the User Setting: Extend User Due Date section of our How to Modify Training Deadlines article. 

Important:You should only use this placeholder in manual past due notifications that are sent after extending a user's training deadline. 
Important:If the training campaign includes multiple assignments, and some of the assignments have already been completed, this placeholder may not populate correctly. For best results, extend the due date for all assignments in the training campaign.
[[password-less_login_link]] Password-less Link

This placeholder populates a link that will allow your users to instantly log in to their Learner Experience. This placeholder does not use HTML.

For more information about password-less logins, see our How to Enable and Use Password-Less Logins article.

Note:To use this placeholder, password-less logins must be enabled in your Account Settings.
[[password-less_link_duration]] Password-less Expires In

This placeholder populates the number of days left before the password-less login link expires.

For more information about password-less logins, see our How to Enable and Use Password-Less Logins article.

Note:To use this placeholder, password-less logins must be enabled in your Account Settings.
[[certificate_list]] Certificate

This placeholder lists the modules for which the user has earned a certificate.

Important: You should only use this placeholder in campaign completion notifications.

Placeholders for Manager and Admin Notifications

Some training information placeholders should only be used in manager and admin training notifications.

For information about each of these placeholders, see the table below:

Placeholder Name Placeholder Drop-Down Menu Option Information Populated
[[user_list]] Relevant User Emails and Names This placeholder populates a list of relevant users enrolled in the campaign, displayed as "Email address, Full Name." These users will be listed on individual lines.
[[user_email_list]] Relevant User Emails This placeholder populates a list of email addresses for relevant users enrolled in the campaign. These user emails will be listed on individual lines.
[[user_fullname_list]] Relevant User Names This placeholder populates the first and last names of relevant users enrolled in the campaign.
[[user_list_count]] Relevant Users Count This placeholder populates the number of relevant users enrolled in the campaign, depending on the type of notification that was used.

articles.name: Account Information Placeholders Guide
articles.title: Account Information Placeholders Guide
articles.body:
You can use account information placeholders to populate specific information from the Account Owner’s Account Settings, such as your organization's domain. For general information about placeholders, see our How to Use Placeholders article.

Important:To use account information placeholders, you will need to fill out the fields in the Account Owner's Account Settings and make sure that your organization's information is correct. For more information, see our How to Edit Your Account Settings article.

For information about each of the account information placeholders, see the table below:

Placeholder Name Placeholder Drop-Down Menu Option Information Populated
[[domain]] N/A

This placeholder populates the email recipient's domain. For example, the domain could be "example.com". If you have multiple domains in your account, the placeholder will use the recipient's domain.

Note:This placeholder is not available from the drop-down menu. However, you can use this placeholder anywhere in templates. To make sure that the placeholder works correctly, you can click the Send Me a Test Email button. 

If you would prefer not to spoof your recipients' domains, you can set the domain that populates for this placeholder in phishing templates and landing pages. For more information, see the Phishing Settings section of our How to Edit Your Account Settings article. 
[[company_logo_img]] Company Logo Image

This placeholder populates your organization's logo if you have set a logo URL in the Company Logo URL field of your Account Settings. This will populate the image as-is from the logo URL. To automatically populate the image, this placeholder uses HTML.

For more information, see our How to Add Your Company Logo, Logo URL, and Brand Color to Your Console article.
[[company_logo_url]] Company Logo URL

This placeholder populates your organization's logo URL if you have set a logo URL in the Company Logo URL field of your Account Settings. We recommend using this placeholder in the source code of your templates as it allows you to adjust image dimensions.

For more information, see our How to Add Your Company Logo, Logo URL, and Brand Color to Your Console article.

Important:You should only use this placeholder either in an <img> tag or by using our WYSIWYG image button to add your logo URL automatically.
[[company_name]] Company Name This placeholder populates your organization's name.
[[brand_color]] Brand Color

This placeholder populates the hex code for your organization's brand color, if you have set a brand color in your Account Settings. 

For more information, see our How Do I Use the Branded Landing Pages, Training Notifications, and Email Templates? article.

Important:You should only use this placeholder in the source code of landing pages, training notifications, and email templates. You should not use this placeholder in the WYSIWYG editor view.

[[street_address_1]]

[[street_address_2]]

Street Address 1

Street Address 2

 This placeholder populates your organization's street address.
[[suite_number]] Suite Number This placeholder populates your organization's suite number, if you have entered a suite number in your Account Settings.
[[city]] City This placeholder populates your organization's city.
[[state]] State This placeholder populates your organization's state.
[[zip_code]] Zip Code This placeholder populates your organization's zip code.
[[account_phone_number]] Company Phone This placeholder populates your organization's phone number.
[[email_banner]] Email Banner

This placeholder populates your organization's email banner. You can use this placeholder to create a text banner or add your organization's official email banner to the source code.

In your Account Settings, you can customize this banner and set the banner to automatically appear on emails. For more information, see the Branding section of our How to Edit Your Account Settings article.
[[signature]] Signature Block

This placeholder populates your organization's signature block. You can use this placeholder to create a text banner or to add your organization's official signature block to the source code.

In your Account Settings, you can customize the signature and set the signature to automatically appear on emails. For more information, see the Branding section of our How to Edit Your Account Settings article.
